i received a response from a woman who
had a problem with my video and did not
like the gospel i was promoting and

wanted to bring forth this private

benefit those of you out there so she
brought up Matthew 5 verse 17 Matthew 5
or 17 which of course says think not
that I come to destroy the Torah or the
prophets I am not come to destroy but to
fulfill now in her words and this is not
just her words but it's the words of
most of modern-day Christianity that
word fulfill Jesus fulfilled the law so
I don't have to do it Jesus fulfilled
the commandments he came to the Phillips
so I don't need to do it he did it for
me this is the fundamental basis of most
of Christianity Jesus fulfilled keeping
the Sabbath so I don't have to do the
Sabbath Jesus fulfilled eating kosher so
I can eat whatever I want now this is
absolutely crazy if you think about it
what the Christian is doing is taking
the atoning sacrifice of Yahshua and
using it as just justification to ignore
and or disobey the commandments I'm
going to say that again what the
Christian is doing when they say that
Jesus fulfilled the law is they're
taking the atoning sacrifice of Jesus
Christ of Yahshua HaMashiach and using
that as a justification to disobey the
commandments or to ignore them
completely and that is exactly what a
Christian is doing when they say Jesus
fulfilled
this what they're really saying is Jesus
kept Sabbath or Jesus ate kosher or
Jesus did this or that so I don't have
to do it that is not the true gospel nor
can it be the true gospel is this
Yahshua's atoning sacrifice gives me the
freedom to obey his commandments once
more i was at enmity against his
commandments but his atoning sacrifice
brings me into a position where i can
start obeying his commandments once
again what does this word fulfill mean
what does that passage mean in Matthew 5
verse 17 I am not come to destroy but to
fulfill without question his meaning in
this place is consistently with all that
goes before and follows after I am come
to establish it the so-called Old
Testament law and come to establish it
in its fullness in spite of all the
glasses of men or Jewish inventions and

commandment contained within this law
and the height and death the
inconceivable purity and spirituality of
it in all branches I just quoted John
Wesley by the way that is what that

Jesus fulfilling the law usually they'll
if they're honest with you they'll admit

instance if you say okay so Jesus
fulfilled the law Jesus fulfilled
keeping Sabbath's you don't have to keep
Sabbath oh yeah yeah I agree with that
Jesus fulfilled eating kosher so you
don't have to eat kosher oh yeah yeah I

shalt not commit adultery so you can go
commit adultery
Jesus fulfilled thou shalt not steal so
you can go and steal oh no that's not
what I mean but that is the logical
conclusion of their position of course
then a Christian will usually say well
no Daniel you see there's a difference
between moral civil and ceremonial laws
what what where is that we're in
Scripture other than in the minds of
theologians is that division in the
commandments we're in the scripture can
anyone point to me where it says that
there are moral civil and ceremonial
laws Yahweh gives these Commandments to
Moshe he doesn't make a division between
moral civil and ceremonial he just gives
them in fact the commandment to keep the
Sabbath day the seventh day of the week
from Friday sundown to Saturday sundown
is given right alongside the commandment
to thou shalt not commit adultery and
thou shalt not still so how can you say
one is moral and one is not that makes
no sense whatsoever now I will concede
that there are different Commandments in
the Torah that apply to different types
of people for example a farmer has to
abide by a certain amount of
Commandments within the Torah that
applies to his farming obviously if
you're not a farmer you wouldn't need to
keep those Commandments a woman has a
certain commandments that only apply to
her during her monthly cycle that
obviously would not apply to a man there
are commandments that can only be done
by a governmental body such as the
stoning of witches or homosexuals cannot
be done by individuals but must be done
by a governmental administration there
are certain Commandments to only apply
to Levites or in the context of having a
temple sanctified by Yahweh but there
are also Commandments within the tour
that applied to everyone in every
situation consider Daniel chapter 1
verse 8 now Daniel was in Babylon he was
in a foreign land he was unable to for
instance do any of the animal sacrifices
that might have been
because there was no temple and yet we
know from Daniel chapter 1 verse 8 that
he kept kosher he would only eat that
which was clean and Yahweh blessed him
modely for that we are like Daniel we
are living in a Babylonian culture and
so we keep those commandments which we
can do such as eating kosher such as
keeping the feast days such as keeping
an honoring Sabbath but I want to come

one gospel that this woman and that most

to stand behind one that allows

obedience I'm going to stand by the one

you continue reading in that very
passage that I began this YouTube with
go on to verse 18 in Matthew 5 4 it says
verily I say unto you until the heavens
and earth pass one jot or one tittle
shall in no wise pass from the Torah
till all be fulfilled in other words as
long as the heavens are above you as
long as the earth is beneath your feet
not one jot or tittle from this torah
these Commandments will pass away I'm

and that means that his Commandments
